DataElement.preferredName: Monoclonal Immunoglobulin Deposition Disease Classification Subtype Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the monoclonal immunoglobulin deposition disease subtype classification.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A plasma cell neoplasm characterized by the deposition of immunoglobulin in tissues, resulting in impaired organ function. It includes the following entities: primary amyloidosis, heavy chain deposition disease, and light chain deposition disease._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A plasma cell neoplasm characterized by the deposition of immunoglobulin in tissues, resulting in impaired organ function. It includes the following entities: primary amyloidosis, heavy chain deposition disease, and light chain deposition disease.

Concepts.definition: A mature B-cell neoplasm characterized by the deposition of immunoglobulin in tissues, resulting in impaired organ function. It includes the following entities: primary amyloidosis, heavy chain deposition disease, and light chain deposition disease.

Property.preferredDefinition: Classification; the grouping of things into classes or categories.

Concepts.definition: A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Monoclonal Immunoglobulin Deposition Disease Subtype Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A plasma cell neoplasm characterized by the deposition of immunoglobulin in tissues, resulting in impaired organ function. It includes the following entities: primary amyloidosis, heavy chain deposition disease, and light chain deposition disease._A group forming a type within a larger type._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sub-type of monoclonal immunoglobulin deposition disease in which heavy chain deposition results in non-amyloid tissue deposits which may cause organ dysfunction.

Concepts.definition: A subtype of monoclonal immunoglobulin deposition disease in which heavy chain deposition results in non-amyloid tissue deposits which may cause organ dysfunction.

PermissibleValues.value: Light and heavy chain deposition disease (LHCDD)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Light and Heavy Chain Deposition Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Light and Heavy Chain Deposition Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rare sub-type of monoclonal immunoglobulin deposition disease in which heavy and light chains deposition results in non-amyloid tissue deposits which may cause organ dysfunction.

Concepts.longName: Light and Heavy Chain Deposition Disease
Concepts.definition: A subtype of monoclonal immunoglobulin deposition disease in which heavy and light chains deposition results in non-amyloid tissue deposits which may cause organ dysfunction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A condition in which plasma cells secrete immunoglobulin light chains of only one type, kappa or lambda. Light chain deposition disease is often associated with multiple myeloma or lymphoproliferative disease, but as many as 50% of patients have no evidence of neoplastic plasma cell proliferation. Light chains excreted in the urine are known as Bence Jones protein. Amyloidosis and severe renal failure occur more frequently than in multiple myeloma. Also known as Bence Jones myeloma. L-chain disease, L-chain myeloma, and LCDD. --2004

Concepts.definition: A condition in which plasma cells secrete immunoglobulin light chains of only one type, kappa or lambda. Light chain deposition disease is often associated with multiple myeloma or lymphoproliferative disease, but as many as 50% of patients have no evidence of neoplastic plasma cell proliferation. Light chains excreted in the urine are known as Bence Jones protein. Amyloidosis and severe renal failure occur more frequently than in multiple myeloma. Also known as Bence Jones myeloma. L-chain disease, L-chain myeloma, and LCDD.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A plasma cell neoplasm characterized by the deposition of immunoglobulin in tissues, resulting in impaired organ function. It includes the following entities: primary amyloidosis, heavy chain deposition disease, and light chain deposition disease.

Concepts.definition: A mature B-cell neoplasm characterized by the deposition of immunoglobulin in tissues, resulting in impaired organ function. It includes the following entities: primary amyloidosis, heavy chain deposition disease, and light chain deposition disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
